title: rustdoc unexpected panic for GSL crate

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
Calling `cargo doc` on the [GSL crate](https://github.com/GuillaumeGomez/rust-GSL/tree/9279d3300de495b55451f13ee5075e61851243e3) results in an unexpected compiler panic.

Steps to reproduce:

1. `git clone https://github.com/GuillaumeGomez/rust-GSL.git`
2. `cd rust-GSL`
3. `git checkout 9279d3300de495b55451f13ee5075e61851243e3`
4. `RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo doc`

The output of step 4 is:

```
    Updating registry `https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index`
warning: path `/home/jim/projects/rust-GSL/src/rgsl.rs` was erroneously implicitly accepted for library `rgsl`,
please rename the file to `src/lib.rs` or set lib.path in Cargo.toml
   Compiling c_vec v1.0.12
 Documenting libc v0.2.36
   Compiling libc v0.2.36
   Compiling pkg-config v0.3.9
 Documenting c_vec v1.0.12
   Compiling GSL v0.4.31 (file:///home/jim/projects/rust-GSL)
 Documenting GSL v0.4.31 (file:///home/jim/projects/rust-GSL)
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.23.0 (766bd11c8 2018-01-01) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'byte index 1 is not a char boundary; it is inside '”' (bytes 0..3) of `”.
Communications`', /checkout/src/libcore/str/mod.rs:2235:4
note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace.
stack backtrace:
   0: std::sys::imp::backtrace::tracing::imp::unwind_backtrace
             at /checkout/src/libstd/sys/unix/backtrace/tracing/gcc_s.rs:49

             at /checkout/src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:68

             at /checkout/src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:57
             at /checkout/src/libstd/panicking.rs:381

             at /checkout/src/libstd/panicking.rs:391

             at /checkout/src/libstd/panicking.rs:577

             at /checkout/src/libstd/panicking.rs:538

             at /checkout/src/libcore/str/mod.rs:1988

             at /cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/html-diff-0.0.4/src/lib.rs:65
  11: _ZN9html_diff18ElementInformation3new17h269f42ee8374d90fE.llvm.2B544E5D

error: Could not document `GSL`.

Caused by:
  process didn't exit successfully: `rustdoc --crate-name rgsl src/rgsl.rs -o /home/jim/projects/rust-GSL/target/doc -L dependency=/home/jim/projects/rust-GSL/target/debug/deps --extern c_vec=/home/jim/projects/rust-GSL/target/debug/deps/libc_vec-394b5b1d81996265.so --extern c_vec=/home/jim/projects/rust-GSL/target/debug/deps/libc_vec-394b5b1d81996265.rlib --extern libc=/home/jim/projects/rust-GSL/target/debug/deps/liblibc-b1ca85687f9f2272.rlib --cfg feature="v2"` (exit code: 101)
```

On my machine, `rustc --version --verbose` yields

```
rustc 1.23.0 (766bd11c8 2018-01-01)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 766bd11c8a3c019ca53febdcd77b2215379dd67d
commit-date: 2018-01-01
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.23.0
LLVM version: 4.0
```
